text: hey guys it's Elise and welcome back to
another episode of my cupcake addiction
on today's episode we're going over the
very basics of making a giant cupcake
I'm going to use a batch of my mud cake
mix if you're not a fan of a mud cake
you could also use your own favorite
recipe but you need about as much cake
mix as it will take to do you about 18
cupcakes you're going to need some

with if you can also use milk chocolate
or you could color white chocolate or
use candy melts and I'm using a little
bit of chocolate ganache all of these

post on the my cupcake addiction comm
website I've got a spatula a serrated
edge knife and I've got an offset

easier I've got some nonstick cooking
spray and I'm using a silicone giant
cupcake mold now one of the main
questions I always get asked at these is
do I use a metal mold and the answer is
not they generally stuck together like
this and I always find the top cooks
about 15 minutes faster than the bottom
so I'd end up with a burnt top and then
it not quite cooked bottom and I find
the cupcakes really hard to get out of
the tins I have a ton of tutorials on my
channel of things that you can make
using this mold so don't think you're
going to be restricted to just a giant

first thing that I always do before I go
getting my case all dirty is I actually
use it to make another case out of

turns out you've got a beautiful neat
chocolate case to store everything in so
in goes half of my chocolate just use
that spatula just to bring it right up
around the top edges and make sure it's
pretty evenly distributed now you can
actually even just shake out any excess
we're going to pop that off into the
fridge for 15 minutes and let that first
coat set and then we're going to repeat
that process and do it again with a
second coat alright so when you come
back from the fridge
your chocolate case should be completely
set so what you're really done there is
you've made two thin coats of chocolate
this just gives you more evenness and
more stability to your base now to get
it out of the case you just want to
gradually just release the edges
and then you can roll it all the way
down the outside of the case now with
your cupcake case be very careful not to
touch it too much around the outside
edges so if I need to pick it up I'll
stick my hand in the middle and my
fingers underneath because otherwise
you're gonna leave fingerprints all
around the outside edge and you don't
want that alright so when it comes to
baking your giant cupcake the most
important thing to do is grease grease
grease so you want to make sure that you
definitely give it a really really great
spray or you can really well grieve that
with some butter alright so you want to
fill your giant cupcake case in 2/3 to
3/4 is a good rule otherwise they just
don't raise high enough so pour it in
filling that top section and once again
it's about 2/3 to 3/4 full now because I
know that that base needs a little bit
longer to cook than the average cake I
like to cut a little circle out of some
baking paper or some greaseproof paper
and pop it straight down on top that's
going to help my cupcake to rise a
little bit more evenly but it's also
going to protect the tops particularly
of that bottom section from getting kind
of too burnt or too crusty because
you're using a silicone mold they don't
have the same stability that a middle
mold would have so like to bake mine
just on a baking tray which but you do
want to remember this top is going to
cook in about 30 minutes and this bottom
is going to cook in about 45 in a
moderate oven once your cakes are cooked
you want to let these cool at room
temperature just on the bench for at
least an hour before you even try to
extract them or they're just going to
stick all over the insides of those
cupcake cases you can release them by
just I like to kind of just pull the

it down around the outside edges and you
should just be able to pop those cake
pieces out pop those ones onto a cooling

risk melting your chocolate cupcake case
once you dry cupcake is completely

with the top I'm not going to do too

sting in the middle so you should have

really helps to fill in that gap and

finally on goes the top of our giant
